camel.sink.path.tableName.name: camel.sink.path.tableName
camel.sink.path.tableName.description: The name of the table currently worked with.

camel.sink.endpoint.amazonDDBClient.name: camel.sink.endpoint.amazonDDBClient
camel.sink.endpoint.amazonDDBClient.description: To use the AmazonDynamoDB as the client

camel.sink.endpoint.autoDiscoverClient.name: camel.sink.endpoint.autoDiscoverClient
camel.sink.endpoint.autoDiscoverClient.description: Setting the autoDiscoverClient mechanism, if true, the component will look for a client instance in the registry automatically otherwise it will skip that checking.

camel.sink.endpoint.consistentRead.name: camel.sink.endpoint.consistentRead
camel.sink.endpoint.consistentRead.description: Determines whether or not strong consistency should be enforced when data is read.

camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer.name: camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer
camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

camel.sink.endpoint.operation.name: camel.sink.endpoint.operation
camel.sink.endpoint.operation.description: What operation to perform One of: [BatchGetItems] [DeleteItem] [DeleteTable] [DescribeTable] [GetItem] [PutItem] [Query] [Scan] [UpdateItem] [UpdateTable]

camel.sink.endpoint.proxyHost.name: camel.sink.endpoint.proxyHost
camel.sink.endpoint.proxyHost.description: To define a proxy host when instantiating the DDB client

camel.sink.endpoint.proxyPort.name: camel.sink.endpoint.proxyPort
camel.sink.endpoint.proxyPort.description: To define a proxy port when instantiating the DDB client. When using this parameter, the configuration will expect the capitalized name of the region (for example AP_EAST_1) You'll need to use the name Regions.EU_WEST_1.name()

camel.sink.endpoint.proxyProtocol.name: camel.sink.endpoint.proxyProtocol
camel.sink.endpoint.proxyProtocol.description: To define a proxy protocol when instantiating the DDB client One of: [HTTP] [HTTPS]

camel.sink.endpoint.readCapacity.name: camel.sink.endpoint.readCapacity
camel.sink.endpoint.readCapacity.description: The provisioned throughput to reserve for reading resources from your table

camel.sink.endpoint.region.name: camel.sink.endpoint.region
camel.sink.endpoint.region.description: The region in which DDB client needs to work

camel.sink.endpoint.writeCapacity.name: camel.sink.endpoint.writeCapacity
camel.sink.endpoint.writeCapacity.description: The provisioned throughput to reserved for writing resources to your table

camel.sink.endpoint.basicPropertyBinding.name: camel.sink.endpoint.basicPropertyBinding
camel.sink.endpoint.basicPropertyBinding.description: Whether the endpoint should use basic property binding (Camel 2.x) or the newer property binding with additional capabilities

camel.sink.endpoint.synchronous.name: camel.sink.endpoint.synchronous
camel.sink.endpoint.synchronous.description: Sets whether synchronous processing should be strictly used, or Camel is allowed to use asynchronous processing (if supported).

camel.component.aws-ddb.amazonDDBClient.name: camel.component.aws-ddb.amazonDDBClient

camel.component.aws-ddb.consistentRead.name: camel.component.aws-ddb.consistentRead

camel.component.aws-ddb.lazyStartProduce.name: camel.component.aws-ddb.lazyStartProducer
camel.component.aws-ddb.lazyStartProduce.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

camel.component.aws-ddb.operation.name: camel.component.aws-ddb.operation
camel.component.aws-ddb.operation.description: What operation to perform One of: [BatchGetItems] [DeleteItem] [DeleteTable] [DescribeTable] [GetItem] [PutItem] [Query] [Scan] [UpdateItem] [UpdateTable]

camel.component.aws-ddb.proxyHost.name: camel.component.aws-ddb.proxyHost
camel.component.aws-ddb.proxyHost.description: To define a proxy host when instantiating the DDB client

camel.component.aws-ddb.proxyPort.name: camel.component.aws-ddb.proxyPort
camel.component.aws-ddb.proxyPort.description: To define a proxy port when instantiating the DDB client. When using this parameter, the configuration will expect the capitalized name of the region (for example AP_EAST_1) You'll need to use the name Regions.EU_WEST_1.name()

camel.component.aws-ddb.proxyProtocol.name: camel.component.aws-ddb.proxyProtocol
camel.component.aws-ddb.proxyProtocol.description: To define a proxy protocol when instantiating the DDB client One of: [HTTP] [HTTPS]

camel.component.aws-ddb.readCapacity.name: camel.component.aws-ddb.readCapacity
camel.component.aws-ddb.readCapacity.description: The provisioned throughput to reserve for reading resources from your table

camel.component.aws-ddb.region.name: camel.component.aws-ddb.region

camel.component.aws-ddb.writeCapacity.name: camel.component.aws-ddb.writeCapacity
camel.component.aws-ddb.writeCapacity.description: The provisioned throughput to reserved for writing resources to your table

camel.component.aws-ddb.basicPropertyBin.name: camel.component.aws-ddb.basicPropertyBinding
camel.component.aws-ddb.basicPropertyBin.description: Whether the component should use basic property binding (Camel 2.x) or the newer property binding with additional capabilities
